# Data Scientist - AI Trainer

Apply on employer siteApply now

Oakville

·

$55.48Per hour(Employer Est.)

Apply on employer siteApply now

We are looking for a data scientist to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.

In this role you will need to hold an expert level of mathematical reasoning- a completed or in progress Masters/PhD is preferred but not required. Other related fields include, but are not limited to: Data Science, Applied Math and/or Computer Science.

Benefits:

- This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
- You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
- You can work on your own schedule
- Projects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities:

- Give AI chatbots diverse and complex mathematics problems and evaluate their outputs
- Evaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications:

- Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)
- Detail-oriented
- Proficient in data science, arithmetic, algebra, geometry, calculus, probability, statistics, and inductive/ deductive reasoning
- A current, in progress, or completed Masters and/or PhD is preferred but not required

Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.

It is a dynamic workplace based on respect, where everyone has a voice and participates in decision-making. We support and celebrate diversity and inclusion, and are proudly committed to environmental, social, and governance (“ESG”) standards. **What’s the Job?** The Data Scientist, under the direction of the Director Data & Analytics, will primarily be responsible to design and develop scalable solutions for analyzing multiple data sets, creating and maintaining data pipelines, data structures, ML/AI models, and reports to improve growth and profitability of the loan business. This position will work to ensure data integrity, reproducibility of analysis and to support analytical models and reports. The incumbent will assess and recommend new business development opportunities exposed through data analysis working in collaboration with the business sectors. **What You’ll Be Doing:** · Understand business processes, internal customer data needs and how to implement robust solution into the overall data architecture · Use your strong coding skills across SQL and Python to support data analysis, data science and automation · Design, build and document accurate data models that are meaningful to business users to satisfy growing data needs · Understand and work with machine learning/AI algorithms, devOps and data pipelines. · Apply machine learning and advanced statistics techniques to design, build, train and maintain machine learning models · Work on building and improving model training, model deployment and model monitoring and drift. · Automate manual processes and reports to optimize data delivery · Create reports showing key risk indicators for auto finance business · Identify and help implement new / alternative data sources that can be used to enhance underwriting, collections or recovery processes · Use data analytics to find process efficiencies in back office processes · Maintain an accurate and complete documentation for all activities and mentor less experienced members of the team · Communicate and popularize the different aspects of the models (method, results, impacts) · Be on the lookout for new trends related to advanced analytics · Share his expertise with his colleagues from the different analytical teams **What You’ll Bring:** - Degree in math, computer science, statistics, data science, actuarial science or related field - +3 years experience in a context of advanced data analysis, if in the financial industry it is a plus - Understanding of profit drivers in auto finance - Proficiency in Python (R or other data manipulation or analysis languages are considered an asset) - Software development experience, preferrable using lean/agile methodologies - Proficiency in Git, Azure devOps, Azure ML and Databricks. - Theoretical and practical knowledge of the main machine learning methods such as regression and classification techniques, decision trees, random forests, etc. -
